Post.title: firewalld
Post._content:
[shuyang](https://www.cnblogs.com/wangshuyang/)[firewalld--firewall-cmd](https://www.cnblogs.com/wangshuyang/p/11941547.html)

## firewalld--firewall-cmd
firewalldLinuxiptables  
firewall-cmd  firewalldfirewalldcentos7zone

firewalldiptables
1. firewalldiptables
1. firewalldiptablesTCP/IP  

firewalldiptablesnetfilterfirewalld iptablesnetfilterfirewalldiptables 
<!-- more -->
### 
```
$ firewall-cmd [ ... ]
```
#### 
##### 
```
-h, --help    # 
-V, --version # . 
-q, --quiet   # 
```
##### 
```
--state                # firewalld
--reload               # 
--complete-reload      # 
--runtime-to-permanent # 
--check-config         # 
```
##### 
```
--get-log-denied         # 
--set-log-denied=<value> #  'all','unicast','broadcast','multicast','off' 
```
### 

#### firewalld
```
$ yum install firewalld firewall-config

$ systemctl start  firewalld # 
$ systemctl stop firewalld  # 
$ systemctl enable firewalld # 
$ systemctl disable firewalld # 
$ systemctl status firewalld #  firewall-cmd --state 
```
#### 
FirewallDiptables
```
$ systemctl stop firewalld
$ systemctl disable firewalld
$ yum install iptables-services
$ systemctl start iptables
$ systemctl enable iptables
```
#### firewalld
```
$ firewall-cmd --version  # 
$ firewall-cmd --help     # 
```
##### 
```
$ firewall-cmd --state  # 
$ firewall-cmd --get-active-zones  # 
$ firewall-cmd --get-zone-of-interface=eth0  # 
$ firewall-cmd --panic-on  # 
$ firewall-cmd --panic-off  # 
$ firewall-cmd --query-panic  # 
```
##### 
```
$ firewall-cmd --reload # 
$ firewall-cmd --complete-reload
# firewalld
```
##### 
```
# public
$ firewall-cmd --zone=public --add-interface=eth0
#  --permanent reload

# 
$ firewall-cmd --set-default-zone=public

# 
$ firewall-cmd --zone=dmz --list-ports

# 
$ firewall-cmd --zone=dmz --add-port=8080/tcp
# 

# /etc/firewalld services
$ firewall-cmd --zone=work --add-service=smtp

# 
$ firewall-cmd --zone=work --remove-service=smtp

# 
$ firewall-cmd --get-zones

# 
$ firewall-cmd --set-default-zone=home

# 
$ firewall-cmd --get-active-zones

# 
$ firewall-cmd --get-zone-of-interface=enp03s

# public
$ firewall-cmd --zone=public --list-all

# enp0s3internal
$ firewall-cmd --zone=internal --change-interface=enp03s

# enp03sinternal
$ firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=internal --change-interface=enp03s
```
##### 
```
#   
Amanda, FTP, SambaTFTPFirewallD

$ firewall-cmd --get-services

# SSH
$ firewall-cmd --new-service=ssh

# SSH
$ firewall-cmd --delete-service=ssh

# TCP8080
$ firewall-cmd --enable ports=8080/tcp

# Samba600
$ firewall-cmd --enable service=samba --timeout=600

# 
$ firewall-cmd --list-services

# HTTPinternal
$ firewall-cmd --permanent --zone=internal --add-service=http
$ firewall-cmd --reload     # 
```
##### 
```
# 443/TCP
$ firewall-cmd --add-port=443/tcp

# 3690/TCP
$ firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=3690/tcp

# reloadreload
# 
$ firewall-cmd --reload

# 
$ firewall-cmd --list-all
```
##### 
```
# FirewallDTCP9999

$ firewall-cmd --direct -add-rule ipv4 filter INPUT 0 -p tcp --dport 9000 -j ACCEPT
$ firewall-cmd --reload
```
##### 


 [P only] --permanent
```
--new-service=<> 
#  [P only]

--new-service-from-file=<> [--name=<>]
#  [P only]

--delete-service=<>
#  [P only]

--load-service-defaults=<>
# Load icmptype default settings [P only]

--info-service=<>
# 

--path-service=<>
#  [P only]

--service=<> --set-description=<>
#  [P only]

--service=<> --get-description
#  [P only]

--service=<> --set-short=<>
#  [P only]

--service=<> --get-short
#  [P only]

--service=<> --add-port=<>[-<>]/<protocol>
# () [P only]

--service=<> --remove-port=<>[-<>]/<protocol>
# () [P only]

--service=<> --query-port=<>[-<>]/<protocol>
# () [P only]

--service=<> --get-ports
#  [P only]

--service=<> --add-protocol=<protocol>
#  [P only]

--service=<> --remove-protocol=<protocol>
#  [P only]

--service=<> --query-protocol=<protocol>
#  [P only]

--service=<> --get-protocols
#  [P only]

--service=<> --add-source-port=<>[-<>]/<protocol>
# () [P only]

--service=<> --remove-source-port=<>[-<>]/<protocol>
# () [P only]

--service=<> --query-source-port=<>[-<>]/<protocol>
# () [P only]

--service=<> --get-source-ports
#  [P only]

--service=<> --add-module=<module>
#  [P only]

--service=<> --remove-module=<module>
#  [P only]

--service=<> --query-module=<module>
#  [P only]

--service=<> --get-modules
#  [P only]

--service=<> --set-destination=<ipv>:<address>[/<mask>]
# Set destination for ipv to address in service [P only]

--service=<> --remove-destination=<ipv>
# Disable destination for ipv i service [P only]

--service=<> --query-destination=<ipv>:<address>[/<mask>]
# Return whether destination ipv is set for service [P only]

--service=<> --get-destinations
# List destinations in service [P only]
```
#####  / 

 http  80 tcp  udp
```
$ firewall-cmd --add-service=mysql        # mysql
$ firewall-cmd --remove-service=http      # http
$ firewall-cmd --list-services            # 
$ firewall-cmd --add-port=3306/tcp        # tcp3306
$ firewall-cmd --remove-port=80tcp        # tcp3306
$ firewall-cmd --add-port=233/udp         # udp233
$ firewall-cmd --list-ports               # 
```
** IP**
```
$ firewall-cmd --query-masquerade # IP
$ firewall-cmd --add-masquerade   # IP
$ firewall-cmd --remove-masquerade# IP
```
****  

 ip  ip  

1.  80  8080  80  8080 
1.  IP IP
```
$ firewall-cmd --add-forward-port=port=80:proto=tcp:toport=8080   
# 808080

$ firewall-cmd --add-forward-port=port=80:proto=tcp:toaddr=192.168.0.1 
# 80192.168.0.1

$ firewall-cmd --add-forward-port=port=80:proto=tcp:toaddr=192.168.0.1:toport=8080 
# 80192.168.0.18080
```
  

  
 
**rich rules**
```
# 192.168.2.208
$ firewall-cmd --zone=drop --add-rich-rule="rule family="ipv4" source address="192.168.2.208" accept"

# 192.168.2.208icmp192.168.2.208ping
$ firewall-cmd --add-rich-rule="rule family="ipv4" source address="192.168.2.208" protocol value="icmp" accept"

# 192.168.2.208
$ firewall-cmd --zone=drop --remove-rich-rule="rule family="ipv4" source address="192.168.2.208" accept"

# 192.168.2.208ssh
$ firewall-cmd --zone=drop --add-rich-rule="rule family="ipv4" source address="192.168.2.208" service name="ssh" accept"

# 192.168.2.208https
$ firewall-cmd --zone=drop --add-rich-rule="rule family="ipv4" source address="192.168.2.208" service name="https" reject"
droptimeout

# 192.168.2.0/2422
$ firewall-cmd --zone=drop --add-rich-rule="rule family="ipv4" source address="192.168.2.0/24" port protocol="tcp" port="22" accept"

# 2ftp
$ firewall-cmd --add-rich-rule="rule service name=ftp limit value=2/m accept"

# ipv4ipv6ftp
$ firewall-cmd --add-rich-rule="rule service name=ftp log limit value="1/m" audit accept"

# 192.168.2.0/2410
$ firewall-cmd --add-rich-rule="rule family=ipv4 source address=192.168.2.0/24 reject" --timeout=10

# ipv62001:db8::/64dns300
$ firewall-cmd --add-rich-rule="rule family=ipv6 source address="2001:db8::/64" service name="dns" audit limit value="1/h" reject" --timeout=300

# 192.168.2.0/248022
$ firewall-cmd --zone=drop --add-rich-rule="rule family=ipv4 source address=192.168.2.0/24 forward-port port=80 protocol=tcp to-port=22"

# 192.168.2.0/2480192.168.2.20822
$ firewall-cmd --zone=drop --add-rich-rule="rule family=ipv4 source address=192.168.2.0/24 forward-port port=80 protocol=tcp to-port=22 to-addr=192.168.2.208"

# 192.168.2.0/24IPIP
$ firewall-cmd --zone=drop --add-masquerade
$ firewall-cmd --zone=drop --add-rich-rule="rule family=ipv4 source address=192.168.2.0/24 masquerade"
```
